title: Dialogic Argumentation and Interdisciplinary Project-Based Language Education: Strengthening Text Analysis and Expression Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Secondary education field experience, foundational understanding of argumentative structures, basic concepts of interdisciplinary collaboration, and secondary-level grammar and text analysis skills
context.additional_context: Enhancing project design and implementation capabilities that integrate dialogic argumentation and interdisciplinary approaches in language education for in-service secondary teachers, with a focus on improving reading comprehension and expressive accuracy for multicultural learners

learning_goals: Learners analyze argument structures from an interdisciplinary perspective, evaluate the logical coherence of texts, and develop the ability to design language education projects that facilitate critical dialogue.

Learners develop three or more **dialogic argumentation frameworks** (e.g., text-based argumentation, contextual vocabulary analysis, multicultural expression strategies) applicable to language education contexts.

Learners design a 3-day virtual collaboration project with a multinational team of five or more members using digital tools such as Trello, Slack, and Google Workspace, submitting a weekly task distribution chart (80%+ completion) and real-time communication logs (15+ entries) to demonstrate project management and language proficiency.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
